creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Charles H. Bell
markings: maker's marks on top of lid and side of bowl; inscribed on side: [MNM]; inscribed on bottom:  [General Mills, Inc. to James Ford Bell, August 16, 1949, his 70th]
text: In 1949 this bowl was given to James Ford Bell by his business associates at General Mills in celebration of his 70th birthday. The silversmith who made the bowl, Philip Syng, is perhaps best known today as the maker of the inkwell used to sign the Declaration of Independence.
title: Circular Bowl and Cover
